field.description: Override the translation machinery
field.title: Enabled

field.description: Default value: %Y-%m-%d (2038-01-19)
field.title: old ZMI property: localTimeFormat

field.description: Default value: %H:%M (03:14)
field.title: old ZMI property: localTimeOnlyFormat

field.description: Allow syndication for collections and folders on site.
field.title: Allowed

field.description: Separate view name and title by '|'
field.title: Allowed Feed Types

field.description: If syndication should be enabled by default for all folders and collections.
field.title: Enabled by default

field.description: Maximum number of items that will be syndicated.
field.title: Maximum items

field.description: If body text available for item, render it, otherwise use description.
field.title: Render Body

field.description: Allows users to subscribe to feeds of search results
field.title: Search RSS enabled

field.description: Should feeds include author information
field.title: Show author info

field.description: Makes it possible to customize syndication settings for particular folders and collections
field.title: Show settings button

field.description: Enable RSS link document action on the syndication content item.
field.title: Show feed link

field.description: Name|format|icon
field.title: Alignment styles

field.description: If not selected only logged-in users will be able to view information about who created an item and when it was modified.
field.title: Allow anyone to view 'about' information

field.description: Specify all allowed maximum image dimensions, one per line. The required format is <name> <width>:<height>.
field.title: Allowed image sizes

field.description: Select which formats are available for users as alternative to the default format. Note that if new formats are installed, they will be enabled for text fields by default unless explicitly turned off here or by the relevant installer.
field.title: Alternative formats

field.description: Variables in the request that prevent caching if present
field.title: Request variables that prevent caching

field.description: Maps content type names to ruleset names
field.title: Content type/ruleset mapping

field.description: List content types which should be purged when modified
field.title: Content types to purge

field.description: Maps skin layer page template names to ruleset names
field.title: Page template/ruleset mapping

field.description: Ensure logging users always get a fresh page. Note that if you are caching pages in a proxy cache, you'll still need to use a Vary response header to keep anonymous and authenticated content separate.
field.title: Only cache for anonymous users

field.description: A list of ETag component names to include
field.title: ETags

field.description: Turn on Last-Modified headers
field.title: Last-modified validation

field.description: Turn on caching in Zope memory
field.title: RAM cache

field.description: Time (in seconds) to cache the response in the caching proxy
field.title: Shared maximum age

field.description: Name(s) of HTTP headers that must match for the caching proxy to return a cached response
field.title: Vary

field.description: Ensure logging users always get a fresh page. Note that if you are caching pages in a proxy cache, you'll still need to use a Vary response header to keep anonymous and authenticated content separate.
field.title: Only cache for anonymous users

field.description: A list of ETag component names to include
field.title: ETags

field.description: Turn on Last-Modified headers
field.title: Last-modified validation

field.description: Time (in seconds) to cache the response in the browser or caching proxy
field.title: Maximum age

field.description: Turn on caching in Zope memory
field.title: RAM cache

field.title: Shared maximum age

field.description: Name(s) of HTTP headers that must match for the caching proxy to return a cached response
field.title: Vary

field.description: Ensure logging users always get a fresh page. Note that if you are caching pages in a proxy cache, you'll still need to use a Vary response header to keep anonymous and authenticated content separate.
field.title: Only cache for anonymous users

field.description: A list of ETag component names to include
field.title: ETags

field.description: Turn on Last-Modified headers
field.title: Last-modified validation

field.description: Turn on caching in Zope memory
field.title: RAM cache

field.description: Name(s) of HTTP headers that must match for the caching proxy to return a cached response
field.title: Vary

field.description: If selected, anonymous users are able to post comments without logging in. It is highly recommended to use a captcha solution to prevent spam if this setting is enabled.
field.title: Enable anonymous comments

field.description: If selected, anonymous user will have to give their email.
field.title: Enable anonymous email field

field.description: Use this setting to enable or disable Captcha validation for comments. Install plone.formwidget.captcha, plone.formwidget.recaptcha, collective.akismet, or collective.z3cform.norobots if there are no options available.
field.title: Captcha

field.description: If selected, supports deleting of own comments for users with the "Delete own comments" permission.
field.title: Enable deleting own comments

field.description: If selected, supports editing of comments for users with the "Edit comments" permission.
field.title: Enable editing of comments

field.description: If selected, users are able to post comments on the site. However, you will still need to enable comments for specific content types, folders or content objects before users will be able to post comments.
field.title: Globally enable comments

field.description: If selected, comments will enter a "Pending" state in which they are invisible to the public. A user with the "Review comments" permission ("Reviewer" or "Manager") can approve comments to make them visible to the public. If you want to enable a custom comment workflow, you have to go to the types control panel.
field.title: Enable comment moderation

field.description: Address to which moderator notifications will be sent.
field.title: Moderator Email Address

field.description: If selected, the moderator is notified if a comment needs attention. The moderator email address can be set below.
field.title: Enable moderator email notification

field.description: If selected, an image of the user is shown next to the comment.
field.title: Show commenter image

field.description: Use this setting to choose if the comment text should be transformed in any way. You can choose between "Plain text" and "Intelligent text". "Intelligent text" converts plain text into HTML where line breaks and indentation is preserved, and web and email addresses are made into clickable links.
field.title: Comment text transform

field.description: If selected, users can choose to be notified of new comments by email.
field.title: Enable user email notification

field.description: Depth relative the site root that body class are generated for.
field.title: Body class path depth

field.description: A list of portlet manager names that will not be shown in the toolbar dropdown
field.title: Toolbar Portlet Manager Blacklist

field.description: Convert relative URLs in the theme file to absolute paths using this prefix.
field.title: Absolute URL prefix

field.description: The name of the current theme, i.e. the one applied most recently.
field.title: Current theme

field.description: Define your own custom CSS in the field below. This is a good place for quick customizations of things like colors and the toolbar. Definitions here will override previously defined CSS of Plone. Please use this only for small customizations, as it is hard to keep track of changes here. For bigger changes you most likely want to customize a full theme and make your changes there.
field.title: Custom CSS

field.description: Time stamp when the custom CSS was changed. Used to generate custom.css with timestamp in URL.
field.title: Custom CSS Timestamp

field.description: You can specify a Doctype string which will be set on the for example "<!DOCTYPE html>". If left blank the default XHTML 1.0 transitional Doctype or that set in the Diazo theme is used.
field.title: Doctype

field.description: Use this option to enable or disable the theme globally. Note that the options will also affect whether the theme is used when this option is enabled.
field.title: Enabled

field.description: If there are hostnames that you do not want to be themed, you can list them here. This is useful during theme development, so that you can compare the themed and unthemed sites. In some cases, you may also want to provided an unthemed host alias for content administrators to be able to use 'plain' Plone.
field.title: Unthemed host names

field.description: You can define parameters here, which will be passed to the compiled theme. In your rules file, you can refer to a parameter by $name. Parameters are defined using TALES expressions, which should evaluate to a string, a number, a boolean or None. Available variables are `context`, `request`, `portal`, `portal_state`, and `context_state`.
field.title: Parameter expressions

field.description: If enabled, network (http, https) urls are allowed in the rules file and this config.
field.title: Read network

field.description: File path to the rules file
field.title: Rules file

field.description: Related to: use cookie for manual override
field.title: Authenticated users only

field.description: After successful password reset the user will be logged in automatically.
field.title: Login user after password reset

field.description: This option gives you the ability to enable/disable auto resizing the editor window depending on the content.
field.title: Enable auto resizing of the editor window.

field.description: Available editors in the portal.
field.title: Available editors

field.description: The languages in which the site should be translatable.
field.title: Available languages

field.description: The timezones, which should be available for the portal. Can be set for users and events
field.title: Available timezones

field.description: Name|format
field.title: Block styles

field.description: Provide the URLs of each proxy to which PURGE requests should be sent.
field.title: Caching proxies

field.description: This option is only relevant if you are using virtual hosting and you have enabled the option to send PURGE requests with virtual hosting URLs above. If you your site is served on multiple domains e.g. http://example.org and http://www.example.org you may wish to purge both. If so, list all your domains here
field.title: Domains

field.description: If disabled, no purging will take place
field.title: Enable purging

field.description: This option is only relevant if you are using virtual hosting with Zope's VirtualHostMonster. This relies on special tokens (VirtualHostBase and VirtualHostRoot) in the URL to instruct Zope about the types of URLs that the user sees. If virtual host URLs are in use and this option is set, PURGE requests will be sent to the caching proxy with the virtual hosting tokens in place. This makes sense if there is a web server in front of your caching proxy performing the rewrites necessary to translate a user-facing URL into a virtual hosting URL, so that the requests the caching proxy sees have the rewrite information in them. Conversely, if the rewrite is done in or behind the caching proxy, you want to disable this option, so that the PURGE requests use URLs that match those seen by the caching proxy as they come from the client.
field.title: Send PURGE requests with virtual hosting paths

field.description: If not set, no caching operations will be attempted
field.title: Globally enabled

field.description: Maps rule set names to operation names
field.title: Rule set/operation mapping

field.description: A list of operations to call, in order
field.title: Operations

field.description: Enter a list of content types which can contain other objects. Format is one contenttype per line.
field.title: Contains objects

field.description: This option enables you to specify a custom CSS file that provides content CSS. This CSS file is the one used within the editor (the editable area). In addition to what is listed, here the plone bundle CSS and diazo themes using the tinymce-content-css setting are also added.
field.title: Choose the CSS used in WYSIWYG Editor Area

field.description: These attributes are additionally allowed.
field.title: Custom attributes

field.description: Enter a list of custom buttons which will be added to toolbar
field.title: Custom buttons

field.description: Enter a list of custom plugins which will be loaded in the editor. Format is pluginname|location, one per line.
field.title: Custom plugins

field.description: You should pack your database regularly. This number indicates how many days of undo history you want to keep. It is unrelated to versioning, so even if you pack the database, the history of the content changes will be kept. Recommended value is 7 days.
field.title: Days of object history to keep after packing

field.description: Select the default wysiwyg editor. Users will be able to choose their own or select to use the site default.
field.title: Default editor

field.description: The language used for the content and the UI of this site.
field.title: Site language

field.description: Select which IDs (short names) can act as fallback default pages for a container.
field.title: Default page IDs

field.description: The content types that should be available for selection when setting a default page.
field.title: Types that can be set as a default page

field.description: Select the default format of textfields for newly created content objects.
field.title: Default format

field.description: Warning: disabling this can be dangerous. Only disable if you know what you are doing.
field.title: Disable HTML filtering

field.description: Show in the byline the date a content item was published.
field.title: Display publication date

field.description: The content types that should be shown in the navigation and site map.
field.title: Displayed content types

field.description: This option gives you the ability to specify the height of the editor in pixels. If auto resize is enabled this value is used as minimum height.
field.title: Editor height

field.description: This option gives you the ability to specify the width of the editor (like 100% or 400px).
field.title: Editor width

field.description: Characterset to use when sending e-mails.
field.title: E-mail characterset

field.description: Plone generates e-mail using this address as the e-mail return address. It is also used as the destination address for the site-wide contact form and the 'Send test e-mail' feature.
field.title: Site 'From' address

field.description: Plone generates e-mail using this name as the e-mail sender.
field.title: Site 'From' name

field.description: Determines if the users should get warnings when they delete or move content that is linked from inside the site.
field.title: Enable link integrity checks

field.description: Enables the LiveSearch feature, which shows live results if the browser supports JavaScript.
field.title: Enable LiveSearch

field.description: Allows users to register themselves on the site. If not selected, only site managers can add new users.
field.title: Enable self-registration

field.description: Exposes your content as a file according to the sitemaps.org standard. You can submit this to compliant search engines like Google, Yahoo and Microsoft. It allows these search engines to more intelligently crawl your site.
field.title: Expose sitemap.xml.gz

field.description: If selected, home folders where users can create content will be created when they log in.
field.title: Enable User Folders

field.description: If not selected, a URL will be generated and e-mailed. Users are instructed to follow the link to reach a page where they can change their password and complete the registration process; this also verifies that they have entered a valid email address.
field.title: Let users select their own passwords

field.description: This option controls how entities/characters get processed. Named: Characters will be converted into named entities based on the entities option. Numeric: Characters will be converted into numeric entities. Raw: All characters will be stored in non-entity form except these XML default entities: amp lt gt quot
field.title: Entity encoding

field.description: Exposes the Dublin Core properties as metatags.
field.title: Expose Dublin Core metadata

field.description: Determines if the external editor feature is enabled. This feature requires a special client-side application installed. The users also have to enable this in their preferences.
field.title: Enable External Editor feature
Open external links in new a window

field.description: To be used with some integrations like Open Graph data
field.title: Facebook App ID

field.description: For linking Open Graph data to a Facebook account
field.title: Facebook username

field.description: The workflow states that should be shown in the navigation and the site map.
field.title: Filter on workflow state

field.description: First day in the week.
field.title: First weekday

field.description: Enter a JSON-formatted style format configuration. A format is for example the style that get applied when you press the bold button inside the editor. See https://www.tinymce.com/docs/configure/content-formatting/#formats
field.title: Formats

field.description: By default, all items created at the root level will appear as tabs. You can turn this off if you prefer manually constructing this part of the navigation.
field.title: Automatically generate tabs

field.description: Name|tag
field.title: Header styles

field.description: Show icons in listings
field.title: Icon visibility

field.description: Enable automatic image captioning for images set in the richtext editor based on the description of images.
field.title: Enable image captioning

field.description: Enter a list of content types which can be used as images. Format is one contenttype per line.
field.title: Image objects

field.description: Name|format|icon
field.title: Inline styles

field.description: Variables that are going to be compiled on less
field.title: Less variables

field.description: A list of strings which the "After the Deadline" spellchecker should ignore. Note: This option is only applicable when the appropriate spellchecker has been chosen above.
field.title: AtD ignore strings

field.description: The URL of the "After the Deadline" grammar and spell checking server. The default value is the public server, but ideally you should download and install your own and specify its address here.
field.title: AtD service URL

field.description: A list of error types which the "After the Deadline" spellchecker should check for. By default, all the available error type will be listed here.
field.title: AtD error types to show

field.description: This option allows you to choose the spellchecker for TinyMCE.
field.title: Spellchecker plugin to use

field.description: Disabling locking here will only affect users editing content through the Plone web UI. Content edited via WebDAV clients will still be subject to locking.
field.title: Enable locking for through-the-web edits

field.description: Determines if your Plone is optimized for small or large sites. In environments with a lot of groups it can be very slow or impossible to build a list all groups. This option tunes the user interface and behaviour of Plone for this case by allowing you to search for groups instead of listing all of them.
field.title: Many groups?

field.description: Determines if your Plone is optimized for small or large sites. In environments with a lot of users it can be very slow or impossible to build a list all users. This option tunes the user interface and behaviour of Plone for this case by allowing you to search for users instead of listing all of them.
field.title: Many users?

field.description: Marks external or special protocol links with class.
field.title: Mark special links

field.description: Look for available extensions at https://python-markdown.github.io/extensions/ or write your own.
field.title: Enabled markdown extensions

field.description: JSON formatted Menu configuration.
field.title: Menu

field.description: Enter what items you would like in the menu bar.
field.title: Menubar

field.description: These tags and their content are completely blocked when a page is saved or rendered. They are only deleted if they are not marked as valid_tags
field.title: Nasty tags

field.description: Number of folder levels to show in the navigation.
field.title: Navigation depth

field.description: Suppress thumbs in all list views; this default can be overriden individually
field.title: No thumbs in list views

field.description: Suppress thumbs in all portlets; this default can be overridden individually in selected portlets
field.title: No Thumbs in portlets

field.description: Suppress thumbs in all summary views; this default can be overriden individually
field.title: No thumbs in summary views

field.description: Suppress thumbs in all tableviews and in folder contents view; this default can be overriden individually
field.title: No thumbs in table views

field.description: By default, any content item in the root of the portal will appear as a tab. If you turn this option off, only folders will be shown. This only has an effect if 'automatically generate tabs' is enabled.
field.title: Generate tabs for items other than folders.

field.description: The timezone setting of the portal. Users can set their own timezone, if available timezones are defined.

field.description: A value for the quality of scaled images, from 1 (lowest) to 95 (highest). A value of 0 will mean plone.scaling's default will be used, which is currently 88.
field.title: Scaled image quality

field.description: A value for the quality of 2x high pixel density images, from 1 (lowest) to 95 (highest). A value of 0 will mean plone.scaling's default will be used, which is currently 62.
field.title: Image quality at 2x

field.description: A value for the quality of 3x high pixel density images, from 1 (lowest) to 95 (highest). A value of 0 will mean plone.scaling's default will be used, which is currently 51.
field.title: Image quality at 3x

field.description: When clicking on a Link type, should the user be taken to the default view or be redirected to the Link's URL?

field.description: This option gives you the ability to enable/disable resizing the editor window.

record.name: plone.robots_txt

field.default:
Sitemap: {portal_url}/sitemap.xml.gz
# Define access-restrictions for robots/spiders # http://www.robotstxt.org/wc/norobots.html
# By default we allow robots to access all areas of our site # already accessible to anonymous users
User-agent: * Disallow:
# Add Googlebot-specific syntax extension to exclude forms # that are repeated for each piece of content in the site # the wildcard is only supported by Googlebot # http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?answer=40367&ctx=sibling
User-Agent: Googlebot Disallow: /*? Disallow: /*atct_album_view$ Disallow: /*folder_factories$ Disallow: /*folder_summary_view$ Disallow: /*login_form$ Disallow: /*mail_password_form$ Disallow: /@@search Disallow: /*search_rss$ Disallow: /*sendto_form$ Disallow: /*summary_view$ Disallow: /*thumbnail_view$ Disallow: /*view$
field.description: robots.txt is read by search engines to determine how to index your site. For details see http://www.robotstxt.org. Use '{portal_url}' for the site URL.
field.title: robots.txt

record.value:
Sitemap: {portal_url}/sitemap.xml.gz
# Define access-restrictions for robots/spiders # http://www.robotstxt.org/wc/norobots.html
# By default we allow robots to access all areas of our site # already accessible to anonymous users
User-agent: * Disallow:
# Add Googlebot-specific syntax extension to exclude forms # that are repeated for each piece of content in the site # the wildcard is only supported by Googlebot # http://www.google.com/support/webmasters/bin/answer.py?answer=40367&ctx=sibling
User-Agent: Googlebot Disallow: /*? Disallow: /*atct_album_view$ Disallow: /*folder_factories$ Disallow: /*folder_summary_view$ Disallow: /*login_form$ Disallow: /*mail_password_form$ Disallow: /@@search Disallow: /*search_rss$ Disallow: /*sendto_form$ Disallow: /*summary_view$ Disallow: /*thumbnail_view$ Disallow: /*view$

field.description: Only the following roles can add new keywords
field.title: Roles that can add keywords

field.description: Path to be used as navigation root, relative to Plone site root.Starts with '/'
field.title: Root
Crop the item description in search result listings after a number of characters.

field.description: i.e. also when the 'set_language' request parameter is absent
field.title: Set the language cookie always

field.description: Include meta tags on pages to give hints to social media on how to better render your pages when shared
field.title: Share social data

field.description: If an item has been excluded from navigation should it be shown in navigation when viewing content contained within it or within a subfolder.
field.title: Show items normally excluded from navigation if viewing their children.

field.description: This shows a custom logo on your site.
field.title: Site Logo

field.description: This shows up in the title bar of browsers and in syndication feeds.
field.title: Site title

field.description: Number of folder levels to show in the site map.
field.title: Sitemap depth

field.description: The address of your local SMTP (outgoing e-mail) server. Usually 'localhost', unless you use an external server to send e-mail.
field.title: SMTP server

field.description: The password for the ESMTP user account.
field.title: ESMTP password

field.description: The port of your local SMTP (outgoing e-mail) server. Usually '25'.
field.title: SMTP port

field.description: Username for authentication to your e-mail server. Not required unless you are using ESMTP.
field.title: ESMTP username

field.description: Sort the default search on this index
field.title: Sort on

field.description: Index used to sort the tabs
field.title: Sort tabs on

field.description: Sort tabs in descending.
field.title: Reversed sort order for tabs.

field.description: Limit tags aka keywords vocabulary used for Tags field and in searches to the terms used inside the subtree of the current navigation root. This can be used together with Plone's multilingual extension plone.app.multilingual to only offer keywords of the current selected language. Other addons may utilize this feature for its specific purposes.
field.title: Limit tags/keywords to the current navigation root

field.description: Name|class
field.title: Table styles

field.description: Enter the list of templates in json format https://www.tinymce.com/docs/plugins/template/
field.title: Templates

field.description: E.g. standard view; This default can be overriden individually.
field.title: Thumb scale for listings

field.description: This default can be overriden individually.
field.title: Thumb scale for portlets

field.description: This default can be overriden individually.
field.title: Thumb scale for summary view

field.description: E.g., tabular view, folder content listing; This default can be overriden individually.
field.title: Thumb scale for tables

field.description: Show thumbnail images in listings
field.title: Thumb visibility

record.name: plone.toolbar

field.default: ltr rtl | undo redo | styleselect | bold italic | alignleft aligncenter alignright alignjustify | bullist numlist outdent indent | unlink plonelink ploneimage
field.description: Enter how you would like the toolbar items to list.
field.title: Toolbar

record.value: ltr rtl | undo redo | styleselect | bold italic | alignleft aligncenter alignright alignjustify | bullist numlist outdent indent | unlink plonelink ploneimage

field.description: This must be a URL relative to the site root. By default it is /++plone++static/plone-toolbarlogo.svg
field.title: Relative URL for the toolbar logo

field.description: It can be on the side (vertical mode) or on the top (horizontal mode)
field.title: Toolbar position

field.description: To identify things like Twitter Cards. Do not include the "@" prefix character.
field.title: Twitter username

field.description: Define the types that should be searched and be available in the user facing part of the site. Note that if new content types are installed, they will be enabled by default unless explicitly turned off here or by the relevant installer.
field.title: Define the types to be shown in the site and searched

field.description: When clicking items in listing views, these types will use the 'view' action instead of using their default view.
field.title: Types which use the view action in listing views.

field.description: e.g.: www.plone.de
field.title: Use top-level domain

field.description: Examples: pt-br (Brazilian Portuguese), en-us (American English) etc.
field.title: Show country-specific language variants

field.description: Use the language of the content item.
field.title: Use the language of the content item

field.description: Required for the language selector viewlet to be rendered.
field.title: Use cookie for manual override

field.description: Allows users to login with their email address instead of specifying a separate login name. This also updates the login name of existing users, which may take a while on large sites. The login name is saved as lower case, but to be userfriendly it does not matter which case you use to login. When duplicates are found, saving this form will fail. You can use the @@migrate-to-emaillogin page to show the duplicates.
field.title: Use email address as login name

field.description: Use language codes in URL path for manual override.
field.title: Use language codes in URL path for manual override

field.description: Use browser language request negotiation.
field.title: Use browser language request negotiation

field.description: e.g.: de.plone.org
field.title: Use subdomain

field.description: Use automatically generated UUIDs as user id for new users. When not turned on, the default is to use the same as the login name, or when using the email address as login name we generate a user id based on the fullname.
field.title: Use UUID user ids
